sentences.en: A group of senators plans to filibuster a measure that would permit drilling in Alaska.
sentences.cn: 参议员们试图阻挠一项允许在阿拉斯加州钻探石油的议案获得通过。

sentences.en: After drilling for several weeks they finally struck oil.
sentences.cn: 在钻探了几个星期后,他们终于发现了油矿.

sentences.en: By drilling, geologists can take measurements at various depths.
sentences.cn: 通过钻探，地质学家可以在不同深度测量。

sentences.en: Drilling is due to start early next year.
sentences.cn: 钻探将于明年早些时候开工。

sentences.en: Drilling regulations, too, have been loosened to speed the development of the fields.
sentences.cn: 钻探条例亦已放宽，以加速油田的开发。

sentences.en: Drilling will continue on the site to assess the dimensions of the new oilfield.
sentences.cn: 该处的钻探工作将继续下去，以便估测新油田的面积。

sentences.en: For those uninitiated in scientific ocean drilling, the previous record was a little over 4 km.
sentences.cn: 对于那些不熟悉科学大洋钻探的人来说，之前的纪录是4千米多一点。

sentences.en: He was rudely awakened by the sound of drilling.
sentences.cn: 他突然被钻孔的声音吵醒.

sentences.en: Rescue workers are therefore drilling a hole on the north side of the mine.
sentences.cn: 因此营救工人正在矿井北侧钻孔.

sentences.en: The same principle was used in a method of drilling in oilfields.
sentences.cn: 油田的钻探方法采用了同样的原理.

sentences.en: There have been proposals to drill for more oil.
sentences.cn: 有人提出了钻探更多石油的建议。

sentences.en: They had accidentally damaged a gas pipe while drilling.
sentences.cn: 打钻时，他们不小心钻破了一根燃气管道。

sentences.en: This diagnosis has since been confirmed by deep - sea drilling.
sentences.cn: 这种特征后来为 深海 钻探所证实.

sentences.en: Yuki is working up an in - home phonics program slated for Thursdays , and I'm drilling her on English conversation at dinnertime.
sentences.cn: Yuki每周四还有一次家庭语音课.我在晚餐时训练她的英语口语.

words.tran_cn: 训练；钻孔机；钻子；播种机

phrases.tran_cn: 空气钻井；压缩空气钻探；风动钻眼
定向钻进；定向钻井；定向钻孔
钻井成本；钻头成本；打钻费
钻机；钻孔设备；钻进设备
钻井液；钻孔液体；钻液；钻井泥浆
振动钻井；振动钻眼；振动凿岩

trans.tran_en: A drill is a tool or machine that you use for making holes

trans.tran_cn: 钻（孔）( drill的现在分词 )，打（眼），操练，训练
trans.tran_en: When people drill for oil or water, they search for it by drilling deep holes in the ground or in the bottom of the sea
